titlestmt.titleproper: Minutes of the Citizens of Philadelphia Favorable to the Formation of a State Relief Association for East Tennessee 1864
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Minutes of the Citizens of Philadelphia Favorable to the Formation of a State Relief Association for East Tennessee

scopecontent.p: The volume contains minutes and extracts of letters of the Philadelphia chapter of the State Relief Association for East Tennessee. The Confederate Army had occupied the Union stronghold of East Tennessee, and many of the Union sympathizers of that area were struggling to survive. Concerned citizens throughout the North, including those represented in this volume, gathered together funds to help support the people of East Tennessee, including those who were living as refugees in Nashville.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
